title: Hadleigh Parkes on his long journey from Auckland Harbour bar to Wales Rugby World Cup quarter final
text:
Wales centre, Hadleigh Parkes, will give himself a little pinch as he runs out on to the field at the Oita Stadium on Sunday to remind him of how far he has literally travelled since the last time Wales faced France in a World Cup knockout match.

Parkes was in an Auckland Harbour bar called The Cloud watching the game with his pals as France took advantage of an early red card for Sam Warburton to beat Wales, 9-8, and deny them a place in the final against New Zealand. Parkes had his sights set on enjoying his off-season with some vague notions in the Kiwi tradition of packing a rucksack and heading off on a round-the-world trip.

Three years later those plans saw him end up in Wales, signing...
description: Wales centre, Hadleigh Parkes, will give himself a little pinch as he runs out on to the field at the Oita Stadium on Sunday to remind him of how far he has literally travelled since the last time Wales faced France in a World Cup knockout match.
